message.content: {"id": "7330", "title": "Make more actions available on text selection", "description": "I could not find the action 'Add Javadoc Comment' until I switched to the Outline view. Currently, the actions in the application are distributed in a way that seems based on personal taste, which is confusing for users. It is not clear why some actions are in the context menu and some are not. While not all actions need to be in the context menu, they should all be easily accessible from the editor. It is not acceptable to force users to switch views.", "OB": "The 'Add Javadoc Comment' action should be accessible directly from the editor's context menu.", "EB": "I expected the 'Add Javadoc Comment' action to be available in the context menu when I selected some text in the editor.", "SR": "To access the 'Add Javadoc Comment' action, I had to switch to the Outline view and navigate to the Edit menu. It should be accessible directly from the context menu when I select text in the editor."}
